description: French sorbet, from Middle French [Term?], from Old Italian sorbetto, from Ottoman Turkish شربت‎ (şerbet), from Arabic شَرْبَة‎ (šarba, “drink”).
Doublet of sherbet and sharbat, related to syrup.

entries.meaning: Frozen fruit juice, sometimes mixed with egg whites, eaten as dessert or between courses of a meal.
examples: After dinner we had an orange sorbet that was very refreshing.
